result.execSummary:
The defendant was charged with both OWI (4th) and Operating w/PAC-Passenger < 16 Yrs (3rd). The defendant was found guilty of OWI (4th) and the other charge, Operating w/PAC-Passenger < 16 Yrs (3rd) was dismissed by the court.

  • Mary A. Harper was found guilty of OWI (4th), an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 346.63(1)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.descr: Application for specific judicial assign approved

records.addlTxt: Defendant shall not consume alcohol or other intoxicants.  Defendant must maintain absolute sobriety and shall not go upon the premises of any establishment whose primary business activity involves the sale or distribution of alcoholic beverages, including bars, taverns, liquor stores and beer tents.  Defendant shall not operate a motor vehicle unless he has a valid Wisconsin driver's license.

9:31 - Andrew Christensen from Green Lake Cty DA Office as Special Prosecutor by phone. Mary Harper in person, in custody w/Atty Moeller. DOB is 5/24/1964; Court corrects same.   Defendant has received copy of Criminal Complaint and advised of rights, charges, penalties and right to Preliminary Hearing. Court finds probable cause. Prelim requested waiving time limits. Prelim & Review set. Court sets bond at $1000 PA Bond  with conditions:   Defendant shall not consume alcohol or other intoxicants.  Defendant must maintain absolute sobriety.   and shall not go upon the premises of any establishment whose primary business activity involves the sale or distribution of alcoholic beverages, including bars, taverns, liquor stores and beer tents.  Defendant shall not operate a motor vehicle unless he has a valid Wisconsin driver's license.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for November 20, 2014 at 01:30 pm.  Review hearing scheduled for October 29, 2014 at 08:15 am.
